techmeme.title: Analysts: Nintendo and Sony are heading into the holiday season with little to offer consumers; the Switch is now seven years old and $700 PS5 Pro is overpriced (Financial Times)
Alibaba, JD, and Xiaomi report Singles' Day sales numbers they say make the shopping event one of the most productive yet, as China's economy continues to sag (Bloomberg)
Baidu unveils smart glasses powered by its Ernie LLM that aim to "become a private assistant" by tracking calories, playing music, and more, launching in 2025 (Eleanor Olcott/Financial Times)
SoftBank says Vision Fund co-CEO Rajeev Misra will step down from his leadership roles; during his 10-year tenure, he led investments in WeWork, Wag, and others (Manish Singh/TechCrunch)
SoftBank reports Q2 net income of ~$7.7B and a Vision Fund gain of ~$2.42B, driven by strong Indian IPOs and valuation gains in startups like Coupang and Didi (Bloomberg)
